attributes.title: Stock Verification
attributes.description:
A stock take exercise was conducted on 7th June 2025 to assess the effectiveness of internal controls that are put in place i.e. Raw Materials, Finished Goods, and Polybags & Miscellaneous.

The following were the stock findings.

 Bread variance- ( -19 loaves)

Brown Bread Variance (+2 Loaves)

 Polybags- (+509 pieces)

Wheat Bran (-3.05 Kgs)
attributes.recommendation: Strong controls on Stocks should be adhered to in order to minimize the variances.
attributes.effect: Minimal stock variances imply strong controls.

value:
Bread stock was within the allowed limit.

Wheat Bran has no set measurement.
The variances are minimal. We shall maintain the controls.

The following were the stock findings.

Ø  Bread variance- (-402 loaves)

Ø  White flour- ( -1bag 25kg)

Ø  Yeast-    ( -26 sachets 125g each)

Ø  White Ingredients- (-7 bags)

Ø  Bread roll premix- (-2 bags)

Ø  Polybags-  (-4,962 pieces)
Previous
A stock take exercise was conducted  to assess the effectiveness of internal controls that are put in place
No significant variances were noted in bread stock.
Operations/Production Department
Ensuring Strong Internal Controls are Put in Place.

attributes.title: Standard Bread Weight Check
attributes.description:
Packed bread samples were weighed to establish if product released to the market was of the desired quantity.

From the selected sample 200g WB - 7% & 400g Brown - 3% were found to be underweight.
attributes.recommendation: Strict adherence to set standard dough weights in order to attain standard weight bread.
attributes.effect: Few cases of underweight imply bread weight standards are adhered to.

value: Bread weight is within the required limit.
Bread weight is within the required limit. To be maintained.

·        Most of the sample varieties conform to the standard weight.

·        The underweight samples were spread as follows; 200g W- 05%, 400g W- 08% and 800g W- 02%.
Previous
Sample varieties of packed bread were randomly picked and weighed to establish whether the branch adheres to weights and measures standards.
Bread weights were found to be within the acceptable standard limits.
Operations/Production Department
Ensuring production of standard weight bread.

attributes.title: Bread Damages Analysis
attributes.description:
Production and market damages were analyzed to determine their rate during production or from market and compare the same with the allowed standards. High production damage rate would suggest product of inferior quality was allowed to the market.

Allowed production damages rate is 0.25% of total production and market damage is 0.2% of net sales.

Production and market damage rate was analyzed from cash flow date 12/05/2025 - 08/06/2025.

It was noted that both production & market damages were within the set limit, as illustrated below.
attributes.recommendation: To adhere to the set quality controls to minimize production & market damages.
attributes.effect: Production & Market damages were within acceptable limits, indicating no impact on revenue targets.

value: Both production and market damages are within the set limits.
The trend will be maintained.

A total of 872 loaves were damaged under production damages which represent 0.19% of the total loaves produced.

927.75 loaves were damaged under market damages (market returns and expired bread) representing 0.25% of the total sales over the audited period.

 Market damages exceeded the set limit by 174 loaves worth Ksh. 9,309.
Previous
The test was conducted to determine the extent of damages produced during production and those replaced as market damages and find out if they were within the set limits.
Both Production damages and Market damages were within the limit
Operations/Production Department
Ensuring bread damages are managed to set tolerable levels.

attributes.title: Cash Verification
attributes.description:
Physical cash was verified on 02/06/2025, to confirm if the cash held by the cashier tallied with book records and whether the set cash operation standards were adhered to and below is a tabular analysis of the same.

       No material Variance was noted.
attributes.recommendation: Observed cash control is commendable.
attributes.effect: Cash loss risk is minimal. This implies strong controls.

value: The cash controls are effective and will be maintained.
To be maintained.
No material variance was noted on the spot-check day.
Previous
Physical cash was verified to check whether cash counted matched that on SAP balances.
Minimal cash variance suggest effective controls were put in place.
Operations/Production Department
Ensuring Cash Controls are adhered to.

attributes.title: Production Efficiency Analysis
attributes.description:
Production efficiencies were analyzed from 12/05/25 – 08/06/25 to find out if the branch achieved the set efficiencies.

Actual production efficiency was 5.09 bags per worker which exceeded the set limit of 5 bags.
attributes.recommendation: Branch management to work towards achieving the set KPI (5 bags).
attributes.effect: The Production efficiency was slightly below the KPI. This implies extra cost of was incurred to hire 8 extra production workers.

value: Noted. The trend will be maintained.
To be maintained.

The branch hired a total of 409 production workers over the audited period hence the expected production was 2,045 bags.

The actual production was 2,044 bags leading to an actual efficiency of 5.0 bags per worker.

The set efficiency was achieved
Previous

This test was conducted to determine if set production efficiency was adhered to. 

Standard production efficiency is 5 bags per staff.
The actual production efficiency exceeded the set limit.
Operations/Production Department
Ensuring set production efficiency is attained.

attributes.title: Packing Efficiency  Analysis
attributes.description:
Packing efficiencies were analyzed from 12/05/25 – 08/06/25 to find out if the branch achieved the set efficiencies.

It was noted that the packing efficiency was 103.44 Bags per packer.
attributes.recommendation: Branch management should keep monitoring to ensure set efficiency is maintained.
attributes.effect: The set efficiency was achieved indicating that the planned packaging cost was observed.

value: This noted and will be maintained.
To be maintained.

The total bread produced over the audited period is 29,377 crates hence the expected slicers to be hired was 303 workers.

A total of 305 workers were hired leading to a packaging efficiency of 89.6 crates per worker which is slightly below the target.

Extra 25 packers were hired over the audit period and the set packaging efficiency was not achieved
Previous
Packaging efficiency was analyzed to find out if the branch achieved the set efficiency of 97 crates per packer.
The set packing efficiency was achieved.
Operations/Production Department
To ensure the set packing efficiency is attained.

attributes.title: Mileage Analysis
attributes.description:
Analysis of motor vehicle fuel purchase and usage was done from 01/05/25 - 31/05/25 assess compliance to company policies and results were analyzed on the below table

It was noted that the fuel consumption for all the vehicles was within the established standard rate, demonstrating adequate control.
attributes.recommendation: It is recommended to continue monitoring fuel consumption closely.
attributes.effect: Economical fuel consumption by sales vans checked operation costs.

value: Well noted and will be maintained.
Strong controls will be maintained.

All the three vehicles showed significant variation in fuel usage as follows.

KCG 427W- Excess 77 Litres

KCM 422R- Excess 41 Litres

KBW 930K- Saved 97 litres
Previous
The exercise was carried out to determine if fuel consumption quantities by sales vans was at par with those provided on the revised permanent file.
Fuel consumption was as per expected set standards.
Operations/Production Department
Ensuring that all sales vans fuel consumption is as per set standards.

attributes.title: Generator Fuel Consumption Analysis
attributes.description:
Fuel consumption tests were carried out to determine if set consumption standards for sales vans were adhered to.

 Generator fuel consumption from 01/05/2025 – 31/05/2025 is analyzed on the below table.

 It was noted that the set standard fuel consumption for the generator was not provided.
attributes.recommendation: The branch management should liaise with KAF to have set fuel consumption standard for the generator.
attributes.effect: Having no set fuel consumption rate for the generator imply generator fuel consumption cannot be determined and accounted for.

value: We will engage KAF to arrange and test the generator and determine its standard fuel consumption rate.
We all are waiting response from KAF.

The generator run for 4.2 hours and used 23 litres of fuel. Its consumption rate was 5.5 L/hr.

Generator fuel usage is within the range
Previous

The exercise was carried out to determine if fuel consumption quantities by generators was at par with those provided on the revised permanent file. High fuel consumption would read increased operation costs.
The generator had no set standard fuel consumption rate to track its fuel consumption.
Operations/Production Department
Ensuring economical fuel consumption by the generator.
